meanings.definition: To establish a new base or basis for something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to rebase her project to include the latest data.
meanings.sent2: The company is rebasing their marketing strategy to target a younger audience.
meanings.sent3: The chef thought of rebasing her famous recipe with a new secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The team captain suggested rebasing their game plan for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent5: After the feedback, the artist started rebasing her painting to capture the essence better.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting the baseline or reference point for calculations or comparisons.
meanings.sent1: The rebasing of the currency caused fluctuations in the market.
meanings.sent2: Economists use rebasing to ensure accurate economic analysis.
meanings.sent3: The rebasing of the ruler made all the measurements inaccurate.
meanings.sent4: The rebasing of the scale led to confusion among the experiment results.
meanings.sent5: The rebasing of the map revealed new geographical information previously hidden.
